thread.title: QIC pays $66 million in staff bonuses
thread.title_full: QIC pays $66 million in staff bonuses | afr.com

author: Joe Aston
title: QIC pays $66 million in staff bonuses
text:
QIC already manages $14 billion worth of real estate assets. Glenn Hunt Share on twitter Share on Google Plus by Joe Aston If you're considering a career change, can we suggest you send your CV towards Annastacia Palaszczuk 'sâ€‹ fund manager, QIC?
The Sunshine State's cash cow has just lobbed its annual report , and anyone who made it to page 43 before dozing off would know it was worth it.
One of QIC's "key management personnel disclosures" was that a whopping $65.99 million was paid to 482 employees for "performance and retention". That's an average of $136,919 per QIC staff member.
That would be if the loot was divvied up evenly. Given well-placed speculation that one top fund manager trousered almost $20 million of the $65 million kitty himself, we're suspecting the 482th lemming in line for a thank-you cheque might have been lucky to pay for a kebab and a car wash.
